PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In order to encompass general financial frictions (like liquidy costs or market power), we analyze the fundamental theorem of asset pricing when price functionals are merely convex (and not necessarily satisfying constant homogeneity as it is the case for proportional transaction costs). We identify a new arbitrage condition, called robust no-arbitrage, that characterizes viability and generalizes the well-known no-arbitrage condition used in models with a linear pricing.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Attitudes Toward Different Sources of Uncertainty
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In Decision Theory, uncertainty aversion corresponds to the phenomenum where people tend to prefer situations with known probabilities to unknown ones, to the extent that these can be compared (Gilboa and Marinacci 2013). This project contributes to this literature by formalizing the following reasonable observation: a decision maker may also exhibit heterogeneous attitudes towards situations which unknown probabilities are derived from different sources. For example, an economist might prefer situations where the unknown probabilities depend on economic events rather than political events.
